questions.question: Which subatomic particles are located in the nucleus of an atom?
Isotopes of an element have the same number of _______ but a different number of _______.
An atom has an atomic number of 17 and a mass number of 35. How many protons, neutrons, and electrons does it have?
A diagram shows two Bohr models. Atom A has 3 protons, 4 neutrons, and 3 electrons in two shells. Atom B has 3 protons, 3 neutrons, and 3 electrons in two shells. Which statement is correct?
options: A and B are different elements.
A and B are isotopes of the same element.
A is an ion and B is a neutral atom.
A and B have the same mass number.

questions.question: The relative atomic mass of chlorine is 35.45. This is because chlorine exists as a mixture of isotopes, primarily Chlorine-35 and Chlorine-37. What is the approximate abundance of Chlorine-35?
Which of the following elements is a halogen?
As you move from left to right across a period in the periodic table, what trend is observed for atomic radius?
Which group of elements on the periodic table is known for being unreactive and having a full outer shell of electrons?
An element is in Period 3 and Group 14. What is its identity?
Which of the following properties generally decreases down a group in the periodic table?
What type of chemical bond is formed when electrons are transferred from a metal to a non-metal?
A diagram shows two atoms sharing a pair of electrons in their overlapping outermost shells. This represents a:
Which of the following substances contains covalent bonds?
The 'sea of delocalised electrons' model is used to describe which type of bonding?
Which of the following molecules contains a triple covalent bond?
Which type of intermolecular force is the strongest?
A diagram shows two water molecules. A dotted line connects the hydrogen atom of one molecule to the oxygen atom of the other. This dotted line represents:
Which of the following molecules exhibits dipole-dipole forces?
Why does methane (CH4) have a much lower boiling point than water (H2O)?
options: Methane has a higher molar mass.
Methane only has weak dispersion forces, while water has strong hydrogen bonds.
Methane is a gas at room temperature.

questions.question: Which of the following substances would have the highest boiling point?
Which state of matter is characterized by particles that are closely packed in a fixed arrangement and vibrate in place?
questions.topic: States of matter and physical properties

questions.question: The melting point of a substance is the temperature at which it changes from a _______ to a _______.
questions.topic: States of matter and physical properties

questions.question: Why do ionic compounds generally have high melting and boiling points?
options: They form a crystal lattice with strong electrostatic forces of attraction.
They are good conductors of electricity.
They are made of metal and non-metal atoms.
questions.topic: States of matter and physical properties

questions.question: A substance is a brittle solid at room temperature, has a high melting point, and conducts electricity only when molten or dissolved in water. What is the likely bonding type?
questions.topic: States of matter and physical properties

questions.question: A diagram shows particles in a container. The particles are far apart and moving randomly and rapidly. This represents a:

questions.question: What is the electronic configuration of a neutral sodium atom (Na, atomic number 11)?
The principal quantum number (n) describes the:
Which of the following is the correct electronic configuration for a chloride ion (Cl⁻, atomic number 17)?
How many orbitals are in the p subshell (l=1)?
Which quantum number distinguishes between the different orbitals within a subshell?
Electronegativity is a measure of an atom's ability to:
options: attract electrons in a chemical bond

questions.question: Which of the following elements is the most electronegative?
A bond between two atoms with a large difference in electronegativity is likely to be:
Which of the following molecules is nonpolar, despite having polar bonds?
A diagram shows a diatomic molecule with an arrow pointing from the less electronegative atom to the more electronegative atom, indicating the bond dipole. This molecule is:
Which of the following is a characteristic property of metals?
options: Good conductor of heat and electricity
questions.topic: Properties of metals, non-metals, and metalloids

questions.question: Non-metals are typically:
options: Found on the left side of the periodic table
questions.topic: Properties of metals, non-metals, and metalloids

questions.question: Metalloids (or semi-metals) have properties that are intermediate between those of metals and non-metals. Which of the following is a metalloid?
questions.topic: Properties of metals, non-metals, and metalloids

questions.question: Why are metals malleable and ductile?
options: Because of the strong ionic bonds between the atoms.
Because the layers of cations can slide over each other without breaking the metallic bonds.
Because they have a full outer shell of electrons.
questions.topic: Properties of metals, non-metals, and metalloids

questions.question: A solid substance is observed to be lustrous, malleable, and a good conductor of electricity. This substance is most likely a:
